description:
Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (Google Ads, AdSense, Google Marketing Platform, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across Sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.

As a Growth Marketing Manager for Google Shopping, you will help drive consumer engagement to Google Shopping, one of Google’s emerging products in the Commerce space. You will define and execute strategies that drive growth. You will work with a cross-functional team across Product Management, Engineering, User Research, among others, to shape how Shopping is marketed and guide future product engagement strategy.

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of acquisition/growth/digital marketing experience.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in a marketing or product marketing role with a consumer-facing focus in e-commerce, retail, or grocery.
  • Experience with customer acquisition best practices and other digital marketing strategies. Experience managing external agencies in the design and development of customer acquisition campaigns.
  • Experience in project management, delivering large-scale projects in a fast-moving environment and distilling market and user behaviors.
  • Ability to think through complex challenges and architectures, design frameworks, and solve ambiguous scenarios with creativity and analytical thinking.
  • Ability to comfortably interface with all levels of management and to communicate cross-functionally.
  • Passion for solving user challenges with product.
responsibilities:
• Develop and scale Google Shopping’s consumer engagement efforts across multiple channels and geographies.
  • Lead marketing efforts to drive qualified traffic to Google shopping for all key marketing and promotional events throughout the year.
  • Leverage analytics and consumer insights to develop optimal messaging and targeting strategy.
  • Partner with Product Management and Engineering to improve customer conversion and optimize acquisitions.
  • Develop and maintain effective cross-functional stakeholder relationships across functions and levels. Collaborate and gain support for your projects across the organization.
title: Growth Marketing Manager, Google Shopping
